transcript:
Moderator: Hello and welcome to this research session. I'll be asking you some questions about your experiences. Feel free to respond naturally. Shall we begin?

Participant: yes I think we should begin thank you for joining me today my name is Steven I'm a user researcher at Deloitte working on using AI tools to create research and interview

Participant: so that we wouldn't have to add ask for any more money beyond the

Participant:  I said well you know my plan is just to send this to Ken and then he said you know and when we get to this other stuff

Participant:  but he does this all the time when something goes bad he just like doesn't want to touch it like one time we had the startup of a unit in the packing

Participant:  but he does this all the time when something goes bad he just like doesn't want to touch it like one time we had the startup of a unit in the packing basically dissolved because it was incompatible with something in the Stream and he just refuse to look at it I had to do it he's like I'm not looking at this cat

Participant:  but he does this all the time when something goes bad he just like doesn't want to touch it like one time we had the startup of a unit in the packing basically dissolved because it was incompatible with something in the Stream and he just refuse to look at it I had to do it he's like I'm not looking at this cat right I mean it really

analysis.content:
1. Key user needs and goals:
- The participant, Steven, is a user researcher at Deloitte working on using AI tools to create research and interviews. His key needs and goals include efficiently using AI tools to streamline the research and interview process, potentially saving time and resources for his team.

2. Pain points and frustrations:
- Steven expresses frustration with a colleague, Ken, who avoids dealing with issues when they arise, leading to Steven having to handle them himself. This lack of support and collaboration from Ken seems to be a pain point for Steven, as he mentions instances where he had to take on additional work due to Ken's reluctance to address problems.

3. Insights and opportunities:
- There is an opportunity to improve communication and collaboration within the team, specifically between Steven and Ken. Addressing the issues of avoidance and lack of support from Ken could lead to a more efficient and effective work environment for Steven and his team.

4. Recommendations for improvement:
- Encourage open communication and collaboration within the team to address issues and challenges proactively.
- Provide training or resources for team members, including Ken, to better understand and utilize AI tools effectively.
- Foster a supportive and inclusive work environment where team members feel comfortable seeking help and working together to achieve common goals.
